column1: lotheg is a Sindarin word meaning "a single flower".
loth is the singular form of the collective noun loth
column2: Editor Carl F. Hostetter notes that lotheg is formed by the addition of a diminuitive/singular ending -eg/-ig to the plural form loth
column3: much like in Welsh where a singular noun can derive "from a plural form by the addition of a singular ending". Cf.
column4: p. 30 (note 42). deriving from the Sundocarme LOT ("flower").
